speaker: Skyline
text: A crane is seen hoisting an object over the skyline._   [_Scene 1 - KACL Frasier is ending his show._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think we've got time for one last caller.  Go ahead, Mindy, I'm listening.

speaker: Mindy
text: [_v.o., softly_] It's about my mother, Dr. Crane.  Ever since I got married, she's been...yes, the cashmere turtleneck is $39.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, what?

speaker: Mindy
text: Sorry, I work in catalog sales, and my boss just walked past. So, anyway, my mom...yes, it's on sale till the end of the month.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mindy, we are pressed for time.

speaker: Roz
text: Hold on, Frasier.  Cashmere for under 40 bucks?  I'll take one in black.  In medium.  Wait, is that medium-medium or unrealistic- anorexic-model-medium?

speaker: Mindy
text: It sounds like you might want to go for the large.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, really.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_cutting them off_] And that's our show.  What size will Roz order?  Will she accesorize?  Tune in tomorrow for the exciting conclusion.  Good day, Seattle.  [_Frasier signs off.  Kenny enters._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Dynamite show, Doc, one of your best.  Rosalinda, great work on the control panel.  I'm going to start calling you "Control Freak."  Well, you're probably wondering, "Who put a quarter in him today?"  I just got a call from my lawyer.  My divorce: final.  I'm back to my tomcat days.  [_yelling with mock enthusiasm_] Lock up your daughters, Seattle!  Kenny Daly's on the loose!

speaker: Roz
text: You might want to lose the wedding ring, tomcat.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, yeah.  Time to remove my shackle. [_He attempts to remove the ring, but it won't budge._] Well, that's weird.  Ooh, that's really stuck!  Funny.  That's how my wife described our marriage. [_He continues to work at the ring, and begins to shake his entire hand violently._] "Stuck!"  [_letting his real feelings escape_] Well, you're not stuck anymore, are you?! Oh, damn it, damn it!  [_Kenny breaks into sobs and collapses with his head on the radio console._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, Kenny, come on, come on.  Come and sit down.  All right, here.  Take a deep breath.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_recovering_] I'm sorry.  This thing's hit me like a ton of bricks.  The only good news is I'll start getting a check every month.  [_Frasier and Roz exchange a look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, um, divorce can be one of life's most difficult transitions. Have you considered seeing a professional once or twice a week?

speaker: Kenny
text: I've thought about it, but prostitutes are expensive.

speaker: Roz
text: He means a psychiatrist, Kenny.  That is what you meant, right?  [_Frasier nods yes._]

speaker: Kenny
text: A shrink?  Oh, geez Louise.  I don't think I'd be comfortable talking to a psychiatrist.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm a psychiatrist.  You're comfortable talking to me, aren't you?

speaker: Kenny
text: Are you offering to be my shrink?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, I could probably handle that.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was going to refer you to someone.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, can't you help him, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know, Roz.  Giving psychotherapy to my employer? It's a bit of a gray area, isn't it?

speaker: Roz
text: [_laughing_] Oh, come on, it's not like he's a real boss.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_rising_] Yeah, Roz is right.  Come on, Doc, I could use a little help.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose if you'd like to stop by my place and discuss your feelings informally, there'd be no harm in that.

speaker: Kenny
text: Thanks, Doc. [_They embrace._] And I'm paying you for your time.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, that's hardly necessary.

speaker: Kenny
text: No, no, no, I insist, now what do you get?

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, don't worry about it, I'll gladly do it for free.  What do you say we get together Friday night?

speaker: Kenny
text: Thanks, Doc.  I wish my ex-wife was as agreeable as you.  And dead.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, maybe tonight's better.  [_Kenny exits.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment Kenny is lying on the Coco Chanel couch.  Eddie is perched on the back of the couch, watching._]

speaker: Kenny
text: [_intermittently sobbing_] And the one time I was winning, my dad "accidentally" knocked over the checkerboard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Kenny
text: And he made me pick up all the pieces, too.  Fortunately, my mom was there with an extra piece of cake. [_He breaks down and cries more freely._]  [_We see that Frasier is sitting cross-legged on the Eames chair, which he has moved between the couch and Martin's chair, and is holding his clipboard._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I see. A controlling, narcissistic father and an overprotective mother.  It has all the earmarks of a classic Oedipus complex. [_speaking to the clipboard_] Well, well.  Old friend, we meet again. [_to Kenny_] Now, let me tell you, your deep-rooted feelings of castration...[_A watch alarm beeps._] I'm afraid our time is up.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_still sobbing_] Wait, what?

speaker: Frasier
text: This has been fascinating.  I believe we are finally on the brink of discovering a road into some real insights.  I can't tell you, I believe I'm as exhilirated as you are.  [_He chuckles warmly.  He has moved to the door.  Kenny has slowly risen from the couch.  Frasier moves to open the door._]

speaker: Kenny
text: [_far from exhilirated_] Yeah.  When are we going to talk about my divorce?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, you may not know it, Kenny, but we already are.  Now, for out next session, I want you to write a letter telling your father how you feel.  Don't send it, just write it.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_exiting and turning back around_] Homework?  You never said there was going to be any homework.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all part of the process.  Good night, Kenny.

speaker: Kenny
text: But I...  [_Frasier closes the door and turns around beaming, quite oblivious to Kenny's concerns.  Martin enters from the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: Geez, I thought that would never end.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, how long have you been in there?

speaker: Martin
text: The whole damn time!  I went in for a beer, and Kenny came in and started crying and I was trapped. [_He gets his coat._] So how's talking about checkers supposed to help him through a divorce?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, the inability to maintain adult relationships often has its roots in parent-child trauma.

speaker: Martin
text: What's your generation gonna do when we're all gone and there's no one left to blame?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I really can't tell you how exciting it is to roll up my sleeves again and delve into someone's psyche.  I don't even know where to begin, although you know, I do think it's particularly salient that the father never showed any interest in the things that were most important to his son.  [_During this speech, Frasier has seated himself on Martin's chair. Martin has largely ignored him and headed for the door._]

speaker: Martin
text: Sounds good, Fras.  Bye.  [_Martin exits the apartment.  He finds Kenny standing outside the elevator._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Martin!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, Kenny, I didn't know you were here.  How's it going?

speaker: Kenny
text: Okay, I guess. [_He pauses._] I have an emotionally crippled father.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't say. [_He calls the elevator, which Kenny apparently had not done._]

speaker: Kenny
text: So, where you headed?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, gonna grab a beer at McGinty's.

speaker: Kenny
text: Really?  Well, I'm sure dehydrated after all that crying.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't say.  [_He has become uncomfortable, and impatiently hits the elevator call button again._]

speaker: Kenny
text: You mind if I tag along with you?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure, why not?  [_The elevator arrives.  They both step in._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, thanks, Martin.  I really appreciate it.  I bet you were a great dad. [_He starts to sob again._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez.  [_The elevator closes.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 3 - Cafe Nervosa Niles and Daphne are seated, in the middle of a conversation._]

speaker: Daphne
text: If you want to learn yoga, why do we need some fancy private teacher?  There are classes we could take together down at the Y.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and afterwards there are anti-fungal lotions we can use together, too.  [_Daphne rolls her eyes._]

speaker: Niles
text: Just give Ahmrit a chance.  If we don't achieve physical and spiritual harmony, the second lesson's free.  [_Frasier enters, carrying a small stack of books._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, you two.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, Freud, Bettelheim...Jung!  Someone's playing with the big boys.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling with satisfaction_] Yes, well, it's for my patient.

speaker: Niles
text: [_surprised_] You're seeing patients again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, just this one for the past three weeks.  Very challenging case, too.  The man has father issues, any number of neuroses, and a phobia or two.

speaker: Niles
text: Sounds to me like you've hit the crackpot.  [_They exchange a laugh at Niles's quip.  Daphne gives a silent groan with her eyes._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry.  I heard it at a convention.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes. [_He continues to chuckle._]

speaker: Daphne
text: So how did you meet this new patient?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can't really say, Daphne.  You know, doctor-patient confidentiality...  [_Kenny enters, interrupting him._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, shrink buddy!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Kenny.  How are you?  Well, if you'll excuse us, we're off to buy sticky mats.  [_They all rise._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_giving in_] All right. [_Niles and Daphne exit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, have a seat, have a seat.  So, uh, how are you feeling?

speaker: Kenny
text: Like a new man!  Last night was just what I needed.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't tell you how gratifying it is to hear that.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah.  Me and your dad shut down McGinty's.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_a bit surprised_] Really?  You and Dad?

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, actually, I'm meeting him here for coffee.  Man, is he a hoot.  He made me completely forget about my problems.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, good for you!  Of course, the object is not to forget about one's problems.  It's to understand them.  Of course, that can take a lot of work.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, about the work part...your dad said something last night that made a lot of sense.  He said I should get out more, and I was thinking, that's going to be tough to do if I'm seeing you twice a week, plus doing all this homework.  I guess what I'm saying is...I want to quit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, I understand it must be painful to uncover what is a very painful past.  But I must warn you that if you run away from this now, you will only be repeating a pattern that will prolong your unhappiness.

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm okay with that.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_agitated_] In these past few sessions, we have uncovered territory that usually takes months to reach!  I don't mean to toot my own horn, but I've been on fire!

speaker: Kenny
text: Don't get me wrong, Doc, you've been great.  It's just...it's not for me.  [_Martin enters._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys!

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, hey, it's Party Hearty Marty!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, hey, it's, uh...[_He can't remember Kenny's bar nickname._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Sir Shots-a-lot.

speaker: Martin
text: Right, hey!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, can I have a word with you for a second?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, I'll get us some coffee. [_He goes to the counter._]

speaker: Martin
text: Nice guy.  Doesn't hold his liquor like you think he would.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you tell him that he should go out more?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, what's wrong with that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he is using it as an excuse to quit therapy.  After one night out with you in a bar, the man is ready to throw away three weeks of intense analysis!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Fras, the guy's finally having a little fun.  Don't you want him to be happy?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not trying to make him happy.  I am trying to cure his depression!  [_Martin gives a look of puzzlement at the paradox Frasier has just uttered.  Kenny returns._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Marty, does this remind you of anything?  [_He tips his head back and downs his coffee as he would a shot of liquor._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Ow, hot, hot!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Get the man some water.  [_Kenny doubles over in pain.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT I   ACT II_  [_Scene 4 - Niles and Daphne's apartment The two of them are on their mats, bended with their legs straight and their hands on the mats.  The yoga instructor, Ahmrit, wearing a long white jacket, walks between them._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: And breathe...Daphne, that is an amazing Downward Dog.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank youl.

speaker: Niles
text: [_knees shaking_] What about me, Yogi?  How does my Downward Dog look?

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Oh, dear.  Can we straighten these legs?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I wish.  Congenitally shortened hamstrings are the curse of the Cranes.

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Well, let's try a different pose, then.  Slowly place your left leg between your hands, pivot your right heel down, straighten your legs, place your left arm on your ankle, raise your right arm, and...triangle pose.  Trikonasan.  [_Daphne effortlessly executes the pose.  Niles has problems, and cannot get his right arm in the air.  Ahmrit, maintaining his low-voiced, "chant" style of speech, approaches Niles to help._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Here's a block.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I don't like the block.  I'll use the...

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Use the block.  [_Niles places his left hand on the block and then raises his right arm._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: [_moving to assist Daphne_] And breathe, and slowly bring your back leg up into Half-Moon pose.  [_Daphne again does this with ease.  Ahrmit concentrates on her.  Niles is apprehensive of even trying this._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Now, feel your breath leaving your body like a note being blown from a flute. [_He accompanies this with a gesture._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I feel it!  [_Niles is having trouble getting his leg up, and his knee is bent._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm a flute, too, Yogi!

speaker: Ahmrit
text: [_patiently_] Yes, of course you are.  Straighten that leg, Niles. [_He tries to assist him._] Straighten it out, straighten it out, there we are.  [_Niles's leg does not follow Ahmrit's hands._] Let's try it again, Niles.  You can do it.  Straighten that leg.  Marvel--[_He notices that Niles is pointing his index finger in the air._] Let's bend the finger, Niles.  [_He bends down Niles's finger, but it pops back up again.  His face expresses frustration, but he maintains his calm._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_beautifully maintaining the pose_] Isn't this wonderful, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_finger still pointing and leg bent_] I love it.

speaker: Ahmrit
text: [_giving up_] And breathe.  And be completely in this moment. Shut out the outside world entirely.  [_Niles's leg returns the floor, and with great effort, he raises it again, still bent.  A cell phone rings immediately after Ahmrit's speech. He answers it, reverting from his low-volume "chant" to a normal voice._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Oh, hi, Mom.  I'm kind of in the middle of something right now. Yes, I'm coming. I told you, I'm bringing the lentils. [_pause_] What do you mean again?  You love lentils. [_softer_] Niles, straighten the leg, straighten the leg. [_Niles collapses completely._] Okay, child's pose.  That's good.  [_Niles recovers, but looks exhausted, and remains seated on the mat._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: [_normal voice_] So what if Jerry brings a different dish to every meal?  It doesn't make him a god. [_becoming agitated_] Has Jerry achieved inner peace?  I'm just asking, Mom, has Jerry achieved inner peace? [_softly, aside to Niles and Daphne_] I have to take this call.  Would you pleas excuse me?  [_Ahmrit exits to the rear.  Daphne emerges gracefully from her pose._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that was fantastic!  I feel so energized!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you are really good!  I hope I'm not holding you back.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're doing wonderfully.  He's paying you so much attention. I think he sees real potential. [_She towels off her hands._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_still seated on the mat_] You don't have to soothe my ego.  Yoga isn't about competition.  [_without enthusiasm_] It's about achieving enlightenment and integrating your inner and outer lives.  [_Niles folds his arms and pouts.  Daphne wants to speak, but is at a loss for words.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 5 - Cafe Nervosa Kenny and Martin are seated.  Frasier enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_suspiciously_] Hello.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, this is awkward.  I believe you know Martin.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking Martin's hand_] Yes, we've already met.  Kenny, there's no reason to feel awkward.  Believe me, I have other things to do with my evening than to share my expertise with someone who could use it.  Now if you'll excuse me. [_He goes to the counter._]

speaker: Kenny
text: So are we still on for McGinty's tonight?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure.  And Kenny, I've been thinking about what you've been going through, and I've come up with the answer.  A suede jacket.  [_Kenny is slightly confused._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the waiter_] Did you hear that?  A suede jacket.  I must have missed that lecture at Harvard Medical School.

speaker: Martin
text: You look good in it, and women love to feel it.  It's like you're a feast for all the senses.  I used to have a suede coat when I was single.  Hester made me put it away, but I'd pull it out whenever we'd have a fight, and in a minute, she'd be purring like a kitten.

speaker: Kenny
text: You should break it out again.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh-ho, at my age?  It would kill me.  Hey, you got time to do a little shopping.

speaker: Kenny
text: Sure, I think I've got my good credit card with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_who has had difficulty enduring the conversation about the jacket_] Leather won't cure your problems, Kenny.  It's a temporary high.  [_Martin and Kenny exit, meeting Niles and Daphne on the way in._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys!

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, Daphne, hi, come join me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_ordering_] Two low-fat lattes, a hazelnut biscotti, and...

speaker: Daphne
text: And one blueberry scone.

speaker: Daphne
text: Your brother set such a brisk pace walking over here, I could barely keep up with him.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, you don't need to do that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why not?  Shouldn't I be proud of my husband's brisk pace?

speaker: Niles
text: [_explaining_] Daphne's trying to build up my ego because she outperformed me at yoga.  It's not a competition.

speaker: Daphne
text: You see.  He's already mastered the teachings.  Spiritually, you're way ahead of me.

speaker: Niles
text: Stop it!  Frasier, wasn't that your Patient X that was leaving with Dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes, now my ex-Patient X.  Actually, I'd like to discuss it with you if you've got a few minutes.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, coincidentally, I just read a fascinating paper on early termination.  Now, the hypothesis was...

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I'll get something to eat.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you have something here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Something else.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, here, try mine.

speaker: Daphne
text: Please, just let me go. [_She quickly leaves the table._]

speaker: Niles
text: So, so whose decision was it to terminate your sessions?

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, uh, early individuation can stem from anything from transference to delayed adolescent rebellion.

speaker: Frasier
text: If only it were that complicated, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's Dad.  He's been taking Kenny to McGinty's every night.  He's giving him therapy in the form of beer and fun.

speaker: Niles
text: Poor Kenny!

speaker: Frasier
text: I know!  I've got to do something.  I-I-I can't just stand by while Dad undermines me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, just be careful not to turn this into a competition.  As analysts, we have to be above that.

speaker: Roz
text: [_who has been speaking at the counter to Daphne_] Hey, Niles! I hear Daphne kicked your ass at yoga.

speaker: Niles
text: [_nyah-nyah_] Oh, yeah?  Well, Frasier just lost a patient.  [_Niles is immediately embarassed.  Frasier is mildly irritated, but shakes it off and drinks his coffee.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 6 - Niles and Daphne's apartment They and Ahmrit are all on mats in a prone position._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Nice Bhujangasana, Daphne.  And yours is very nice too, Niles. You're doing so much better this week.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  I just did what you suggested, and imagined myself having the reptilian sinuousness of a lizard scuttling across the desert floor.

speaker: Ahmrit
text: I thought I said rain forest.

speaker: Niles
text: You did, but I don't like the damp.

speaker: Ahmrit
text: [_rising_] This next move is a little trickier.  I'll demonstrate on Daphne.  First of all, bring up your knees like this.  Now bring your arms back towards your ankles.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_collapsing with sudden pain_] Ooh.  I don't think I can do this one, it hurts.

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Oh, don't push.  You should be feeling discomfort, not pain. If you feel pain, ease yourself gently back towards discomfort.

speaker: Niles
text: Is it something like this, Yogi?  [_Niles is performing the move perfectly, but his lips pursed.  He is controlling himself with great effort.  Daphne gasps._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: I'm impressed, Niles.  You know, perhaps one day, you might be able to achieve upward bow--Urdhbadhanurasana.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you mean this one?  [_Niles turns on his back and arches upward, supported by his hands and feet.  His head is upside down.  He executes it perfectly._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: [_amazed_] Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, remind me to tell Rosa to vacuum the sisal.

speaker: Ahmrit
text: I'm speechless, Niles.  I've never seen such a rapid improvement.

speaker: Daphne
text: How did you do that?  Oh, I think I tweaked a muscle on that last pose.

speaker: Niles
text: [_still arched upward_]  Oh, no, we should put some ice on that.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising_] Good idea.  I guess we know who's better at yoga now. [_She exits toward the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: Now, Daphne, there's no better.  It's all about achieving oneness of body and spirit.  [_Ahmrit approaches to help Niles out of the pose.  With Daphne gone, he feels safe to say the following to Ahmrit._]

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, now I need _you_ to take me to the hospital. [_He painfully comes out of the pose._]

speaker: Ahmrit
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: I broke my body.  I dislocated my shoulder and...I think that one of my ribs has achieved two-ness.  [_Ahmrit helps Niles to his feet.  Daphne re-enters._]

speaker: Daphne
text: What's going on?

speaker: Niles
text: [_leaning on Ahmrit and concealing his pain_] Ahmrit and I were just going to go out and get a chai tea.  Can we get you one?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_going up the stairs_] No thanks.  You're amazing.  You have so much energy.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, well...you know what they say. [_waiting for her to leave_] Quickly, quickly...

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Just imagine the pain leaving your body like a wisp of smoke.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, if you could get the door, I'm starting to hemorrhage.

speaker: Ahmrit
text: Okay.  [_He helps Niles exit, and closes the door.  Niles thanks him with a gesture.  Fade out._]  **McGINTY'S: GOOD FOOD, GOOD FUN, BAD SECURITY**  [_Scene 7 - McGinty's Bar Kenny and Martin are seated at a table.  Frasier enters and appoaches. Kenny is wearing a suede jacket._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  What are you doing her, Fras?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just thought maybe the three of us could have a little chat.  [_A blonde approaches Kenny and he rises, placing his arm around her._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Doc.  This is Trudy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Delighted I'm sure.

speaker: Trudy
text: [_drunkenly_] Hey!

speaker: Kenny
text: I'd love to stay and chat, Doc, but me and Trudy have a dinner date with the Colonel. [_Trudy continues to hang on him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you think you're ready for that.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, I'm not hungry now, but I probably will be when we get there.  See you guys later.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye.

speaker: Trudy
text: Nice to meet 'ya.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise, I'm sure. [_as they exit_] Have a great time! [_Kenny gestures happily back to Frasier._] He's doomed. [_He takes a seat._]

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?  He scored, and she's a cheap date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, please, he is not ready for a relationship.  How could you let him do something like this?

speaker: Martin
text: Don't blame me for that, it was the jacket.  He wasn't here ten minutes before she wanted to touch it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, all you're doing is allowing him to wallow in his state of denial.  And what if she rejects him, hmm?  The man already has abandonment issues.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, will you cut out the psychological mumbo-jumbo?  Let the guy have a good time.

speaker: Frasier
text: What did you just say?

speaker: Martin
text: I said let the guy have some fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, before that.  You said "psychological mumbo-jumbo."  So that's how you characterize my life's work?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm just saying that I don't think therapy is for everybody. Like Kenny--he just needed to loosen up.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angrily_] Oh, really?  So tell me, Dr. Party-Hearty-Marty. Who, in your expert opinion _does_ need therapy?

speaker: Martin
text: [_thinking_] Well...Hitler.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_deeply shocked and taken aback_] Hitler?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, and that woman with all the different personalities, um... Sybil.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_scowling_] Hitler.  And Sybil.  Anyone else?

speaker: Martin
text: [_thinking_] No.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_jumping back suddenly_] Great!  An entire science devoted to Hitler and Sybil.  Do you believe that...that Niles and I have been wasting our lives? [_becoming passionate_] Do you think Mom wasted her life?

speaker: Martin
text: Now, you calm down, Frasier.  I'm just saying that you overcomplicate things.  Yes, Kenny needed to talk out some problems, but he didn't need to analyze every moment of his childhood.  That's where it gets into the mumbo-jumbo.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just trying to get to the root of his problems.

speaker: Martin
text: You know what, I think you needed to give therapy more than he needed to get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: And you know what I think?  I think I'm finished listening to you! [_He rises and quickly sits again._] All right, fine, maybe I did enjoy it.  Look, it's what I was trained to do, it's what I love to do, and I still think I was doing Kenny some good.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Frasier, you know, Kenny's not the only one with mental problems.

speaker: Frasier
text: And what's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Martin
text: It means you can start seeing other patients.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizing that he was offended too easily_] Oh, right, right. Well, I've thought about that.

speaker: Martin
text: Why not, if you love it?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps I could start seeing people a couple of nights a week.  I could even convert Daphne's old room into an office.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you do, while they're waiting, they're watching what  [_Kenny re-enters, looking depressed._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Martin
text: Kenny!  What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Kenny
text: I don't think Trudy and I are a fit.  When we got to the parking lot, her boyfriend pushed me down and took my jacket.

speaker: Martin
text: Aw, I'm sorry.

speaker: Kenny
text: I feel like such a loser.

speaker: Martin
text: No, you're not a loser.  And if you need to talk about this-- Frasier's pretty good at this sort of thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Kenny, I'll tell you what.  Whenever you're ready, okay? For the time being, why don't you let a couple of buddies get you a beer, okay? [_He raises his hand to call a server._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Thanks.  You know it's too bad that Trudy was just setting me up to get mugged because up to that point, we were really cooking.  Well, here's to dating!  [_Kenny downs his beer.  Frasier and Martin roll their eyes at each other. Fade out._]
